intro: Xanthophyllum gracile, commonly known as the slender goldleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and sandy habitats. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Xanthophyllum gracile is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience in arid conditions.
